Perhaps the most diverse Undergang album released thus far, these 10 tracks feature all the mid-paced groove, vile vocals, and catchy caveman riffs they've become known for, while expanding a bit into a doomy and cosmic atmosphere - but fear not! While they are branching out ever so slightly, they remain true to what made them so great to begin with, offering enough barbarity, blast beats, and tremolo picked riffage to satiate all your sick desires. This edition comes with a booklet insert, featuring plenty of additional artwork alongside the lyrics.

name: Wretched Inferno - Decayed Butchery - CD
description: The first full-length by the New England metal maniacs. This is an incredibly solid death metal album, pulling influences from OSDM, BDM, goregrind, and a little bit of thrash. A definite evolution into their own sound, coming fully into the realm of death metal and getting away from the thrashiness of their early demos. It's really hard to believe how young these guys are (around 17 at the time of this album by my math) as this truly feels like an album put together by metal veterans.

name: Transgressor - Transmigration / Morbid Brochus - MC
description: Official cassette reissue of the classic Transmigration demo, containing the Morbid Brochus EP and a previously unreleased track on the B side. Classic old school death metal from Japan that just seems to get better with age.

name: Wombbath - Brutal Mights / Several Shapes - MC
description: Cassette compilation of the Brutal Mights demo and Several Shapes EP, plus a bonus previously unreleased track. A little more brutal than other Swedish death metal bands of the time, Wombbath made something special with that classic chainsaw guitar tone. These tracks laid the perfect foundation for a long and storied career

options.name: Wombbath - Brutal Mights / Several Shapes - MC

name: Baphomet - Final Confessor - MC
description: The lone demo by the short-lived Icelandic death metal trio Baphomet. Classic old school sound with some catchy melodic riffs, tastefully growled vocals, and perfectly groovy drums and bass. It's a shame these guys didn't stick around longer, because if this demo is any indication they would have been off the charts

name: Skinned Corpse - Latrine Filth - MC
description: The second full-length by the Estonian/French grinding death metal duo Skinned Corpse. Sick, brutal, and absolutely chock full of riffs - this one has everything you need in 36 minutes of madness

name: Begravet i Skogen - Demo - MC
description: Debut demo by the Norwegian project Begravet i Skogen. Cold and haunting, this is 2 long tracks of beautifully crafted, crushing, ambient death/doom, adding up to a 24-minute runtime.

name: Vultures - Divine Retribution Unleashed - MC
description: The debut EP by the Indonesian death metal trio Vultures. Featuring 6 carefully crafted tracks over 23 minutes, these guys are going to be ones to watch. Some of the catchiest riffage around, with a sound reminiscent of Mortiferum or Spectral Voice.

name: Black Dust - Katorga on a Distant Planet - CD, MC
description: Debut EP by the duo from Tbilisi, Georgia Black Dust. A nearly 30-minute runtime over 6 tracks takes a death metal journey through parts unknown. With cover art and a title like that, you know what you're getting into before you even hear the instrumental opener - twisting, foreboding, cosmic death metal for the ages. Similar in style to early Blood Incantation but with a more primitive edge - I wouldn't be surprised if these guys end up in a similar limelight in years to come.

name: God Disease - Apocalyptic Doom - CD
description: Apocalyptic Doom - an apt title for this slab of monolithic, universe-shattering death/doom. God Disease return with their sophomore effort, an ambitious and expansive album that addresses the inevitability of our certain end. Verging on funeral doom at times, the crushing riffs and vocals build a world of swirling madness before tearing it all down and abandoning it to the void.

name: Drain Death - Merciless Of Doom - MC
description: Debut full-length by the Indonesian Drain Death, available on cassette tape via Remorseless Records. Fusing death metal with crust punk, the duo manages to create the perfect blend of energy, aggression, and groove. Vomited out over 10 tracks, the album summarizes the concept of bad fates given by the creator to all living creatures - exploring the dark elements of this nightmare! Demo versions of a few tracks can be heard here:

options.name: Drain Death - Merciless Of Doom - MC

name: Jagadjagal - Demo MMXXIV - MC
description: The newest demo by the Indonesian Jagadjagal, available on cassette tape via Remorseless Records. The band is bringing their brand of butchery to the world, having developed from doom into their new primitive blackened death doom sound. 3 tracks of absolutely crushing metal, delivered on a professional sonic smoke tint tape. Seamlessly transitioning between the slow gloomy riffs of doom and the whiplash fast blasts of death metal, all coated in a grimy, blasphemous black shroud - these guys manage to cover a lot of ground in a short time. The showcase of skills on this 12-minute demo will have you eagerly awaiting their next release.

name: Malevolent Creation - In Cold Blood - CD
description: Fifth full-length by the emperors of evil Malevolent Creation. Introducing a slightly more modern sound than their previous releases, these guys really stepped up the insanity. Plenty of blasting, a super tight production, and lots and lots of brutal, face-ripping riffage. Featuring the peerless Derek Roddy on drums, this album stands out in MC's discography as one of their fastest and most brutal. CD comes housed in a special edition slipcase.

options.name: Malevolent Creation - In Cold Blood - CD

name: Grave - Necropsy - The Complete Demo Recordings 1986-1991 - 2CD
Runemagick - Moon of the Chaos Eclipse - CD
description: Re-mastered edition of the oft-overlooked full-length by the criminally underappreciated Swedish occult death/doom acolytes Runemagick. Combining countless eerie bad-acid-trip doom riffs with some of the grooviest chugging mid-pace death metal and tremolo picked madness, this album managed to capture lightning in a bottle. Perfect for fans of OSDM, stoner doom, or anything with an occult edge to it.

options.name: Runemagick - Moon of the Chaos Eclipse - CD

name: Frozen Soul - Glacial Domination - CD
description: Second full-length by the Texan modern OSDM outfit Frozen Soul. I'm still not quite sure why a death metal band from Texas chose to brand themselves with cold and ice, but it's as good a branding as any and at least they stuck with a theme. This album marks a progression from their debut, with slightly more intricate songwriting while maintaining the catchy Bolt Thrower style riffage and vocals that made them popular in the first place. 11 tracks over 42 minutes of classic old school death metal - this South American edition CD comes with an obi strip courtesy of Old Shadow Records.

name: Catacomb Abscess - Primeval Mutilation - CD
description: Fast, blasting, brutal debut by the Russian lunatics Catacomb Abscess. Grinding HM-2 style riffs over chaotic drumming and vomited vocals, these guys launched out of the gate and went straight for the throat. A couple covers of songs by Regurgitate and Dead Infection shine a light on the influences, while twisting, mid-pace death metal sections offer a reprise from the goregrind madness. Certainly not one for the faint of heart.

name: Malevolent Creation - The Fine Art of Murder - CD
description: The sixth full-length by legends Malevolent Creation. Re-introducing the late great Brett Hoffman on vocals, this album can easily stand tall alongside the highly respected debut The Ten Commandments. Featuring some of their catchiest riffs and blastiest drumming to date, this one will go down as one of their best. CD comes housed in a special edition slipcase.

options.name: Malevolent Creation - The Fine Art of Murder - CD

name: Grave - As Rapture Comes - CD
description: The classic 7th album by the Swedish legends Grave. Encompassing the ferocious sound that made them legends in the 90s, Grave's 2006 album has all the heavy as hell slow and punishing segments while embracing some modern blasting, tremolo filled brutality. A nice production on this one allows it to stand toe-to-toe with other modern classics. The CD is housed in a special edition slipcase.

name: ...and Oceans - As in Gardens, So in Tombs - CD
description: The latest (sixth) full-length by the Finnish symphonic black metallers ...and Oceans. 10 tracks over 50 minutes of melodic, monumental, blasting metal, ...and Oceans have compiled their musical experience from the past 30 years to create an epic soundscape. A step forward but also a return to form, this album will certainly stand as one of their greatest accomplishments.

options.name: ...and Oceans - As in Gardens, So in Tombs - CD

name: Brodequin - Methods of Execution - CD
description: The third full-length by brutal death legends Brodequin, and the last release before their initial breakup. Featuring a slightly different mix than their previous albums, the lightning-fast guitar riffs are at the forefront this time around - however, the frantic, blasting drums, groovy basslines, and low squealed vocals are all equally as discernable. The CD comes housed in a special edition slipcase.

name: Brodequin - Festival of Death - CD
description: The second full-length by the madmen known as Brodequin. Hot on the heels of their previous release, this one seems to somehow step up the already insane blasting speed, while including some seriously catchy riffs. The CD comes housed in a special edition slipcase and contains a hidden Last Days of Humanity cover track

name: Brodequin - Instruments of Torture - CD
description: The classic debut by the Tennessee titans of BDM Brodequin. An apt title for a band named for torture, and opening with a song about a breaking wheel, this album truly set the stage for Brodequins' long and storied career. Featuring some of the best blasting drums in the biz, frantic buzzsaw riffs, and classic brutal growls, this one has it all. The CD comes housed in a special edition slipcase and includes 2 bonus tracks - a Dead Infection cover and an original from a split album released in 2002.

name: Bone Weapon - Thrive or Starve - CD
description: Debut EP by the new Philadelphia death/doom trio Bone Weapon. Primitive and barbaric, the 24 minute runtime explores the brutality and savagery of early mankind. The not quite clean production adds to the atmosphere, evoking the feeling of clawing your way out of prehistoric times. Growing heavier with each track, these guys seem to be on the perfect trajectory and I'm certainly looking forward to another release.

options.name: Bone Weapon - Thrive or Starve - CD

name: Guts - Decay - CD
description: The debut full-length by the Finnish death metal quintet Guts. 9 tracks over 35 minutes of classic old school death, featuring riffs galore and enough groove to keep your head banging. Plodding mid-pace rhythms coupled with crushing atmosphere and soaring leads, these Finns managed to capture everything great from the 90's without leaning into any trends or traps of modernity.

name: Sedimentum - Derrière les Portes d'une Arcane Transcendante - LP
description: The latest EP by Quebec quartet Sedimentum, on 12" vinyl. 3 deadly death metal tracks over 21 minutes, showcasing their twisting riffage and massive soundscapes, reminiscent of classic Finnish death/doom. A noticeable increase in focus on the low-end on this release, Sedimentum manage to sound heavier than ever without veering far from what made them great in the first place.

options.name: Sedimentum - Derrière les Portes d'une Arcane Transcendante - LP

name: Corpsessed - Succumb to Rot - LP
description: The latest full-length by the Finnish death metal maestros available on 12" vinyl.  Opening with a creepy orchestral intro, it doesn't take long before devolving into the ferocious, brooding riffs they've become known for. Leaning into the doomy side of things as any good Finndeath band does, they manage to make even the slower sections feel aggressive and punishing. This album aptly showcases their dynamic range, and may very well be the best album they've released to date.

name: Malignant Altar - Retribution of Jealous Gods - LP, MC
description: The astounding demo that brought Malignant Altar into everyone's conscience, Retribution of Jealous Gods available on cassette and 12" vinyl. While the band was short lived, their ideas live on, with this demo seeing many re-issues on multiple formats - these particular versions containing 2 bonus tracks from their first demo release. Plenty of crushing, menacing riffs, a gloomy atmosphere, and just all-around quality death metal. The Celtic Frost influence is evident, and a well-done cover of Procreation of the Wicked brings things full circle.

name: Engulfed - Vengeance of the Fallen - MLP
description: The 3rd release by the Turkish Engulfed, coming in a few years after their first full-length. On the longer side for an EP at 25 minutes, this was pressed on 12" vinyl and plays more like a short full-length. This mini album is a crushing display, and the trio somehow managed to improve over their already impressive previous work in just about every way. This unwavering slab of death metal features the furious riffs, snappy drums, and putrid vocals these guys have become known for, while also managing to build an odious atmosphere of impending doom, woven intricately through masterful songwriting.

options.name: Engulfed - Vengeance of the Fallen - MLP

name: Dead Congregation - Graves of the Archangels - CD
description: Debut full-length by the Greek gods Dead Congregation. One of the most incredible debuts in death metal, this is one that has, and will continue to, stand the test of time. The haunting opening, the mournful chants, the slow doomy grooves, the old-school Finndeath riffs, and the whiplash blasts - this album has it all, and cemented Dead Congregation firmly at the forefront of modern metal.

options.name: Dead Congregation - Graves of the Archangels - CD

name: Deiquisitor - Sword of Pestilence - 7"
description: EP from 2017 showcasing 4 new songs hot on the heels of their debut full-length. This is the perfect encapsulation of their early sound, featuring down-tuned, relentless, oppressive riffs and atmosphere.

name: Undergang / Anatomia - Split - LP
description: Split album by 2 of the heaviest of heavy weights, Undergang and Anatomia, together at last. 2 tracks by Anatomia to open side A, featuring the gloomy, creeping death/doom style they have become known for. Side B features 3 tracks by Undergang, encompassing their bludgeoning, grimy sound. These bands complement each other's style quite well, and hopefully we see them team up again in the future.

name: Morbific - Ominous Seep of Putridity - LP
description: Debut full-length by the Finnish newcomers Morbific. Grotesque, cavernous death metal full of crushing riffs, pulverizing drums, plenty of groove, and just enough doom to sound like a true old-school Finndeath album. Boasting a thick and powerful production, this one will have you bobbing your head from start to finish, with each instrument clearly heard and every note perfectly delivered.

options.name: Morbific - Ominous Seep of Putridity - LP

name: Wretched Inferno - Cacophony of Filth - CD
description: Sophomore album by the Massachusetts death metal act Wretched Inferno. Holy hell this is some hard-hitting death metal. Insanely catchy riffs, perfectly complementing bass, ear-shredding dual attack vocals, and some serious death metal drumming. A little bit of that ooga-booga caveman rhythm and the pinging snare push this over into BDM territory, but it never collapses into a wall of sound and each instrument maintains clarity from one another. These guys have managed to avoid the second-album slump, and in fact may have delivered their best work so far.

options.name: Wretched Inferno - Cacophony of Filth - CD

name: Kaspyx - Demo MMXXIII - CD
description: The debut demo by the Indonesian death/doomsters Kaspyx. Powerful leads influenced by the likes of Autopsy and Anatomia, crushing drums and bass, and cavernous, dripping vocals - very promising start for the youngsters. Featuring 4 tracks over 19 minutes, this one will be on repeat for a while.

name: Hideous Divinity - Unextinct - MC
description: Technical/Brutal death metal masters Hideous Divinity return with their 5th full-length release, available on tape courtesy of Gruesome Records in Portugal. 5 years since their previous full-length, this one picks up right where they left off then continues to take it even further. Furious yet melodic, frantic yet rhythmic, Hideous Divinity take the tech-death of Suffocation or Nile and add a certain refined flair, which when coupled with the excellent production, makes for a release that reveals more nuance with every listen.

name: Brodequin Discography Bundle
description: All 4 full-length albums by the brutal death metal masters Brodequin on special edition slipcase CDs. Get 'em all at once and save ~20%. Available as long as all 4 albums are in stock.

name: Fossilization - Leprous Daylight - LP, CD
description: Debut full-length by Brazilian death/doom heavyweights Fossilization. These guys drummed up quite a bit of interest with their early EP and split, and they followed it up beautifully with this album. Ranging from all-out blasting and tremolo picked death, to moody, cavernous doom, these guys have the range to cover whatever ground they please.

name: Engulf - The Dying Planet Weeps - LP
description: Debut full-length album by the New Jersey one-man (slightly blackened) death metal project Engulf. Ample blasting and angular riffs show some Morbid Angel influence, while the more avant-garde choices point towards Gorguts. Very impressive song writing and album overall- and a clear step up from the previous EP releases - I think we will hear plenty of talk about Engulf in the coming years.

options.name: Engulf - The Dying Planet Weeps - LP

name: Unholy Redeemer - A Fever to Dethrone All Kings - MC
description: Don't let the black metal-esque cover art fool you - this demo marks the coming of an incredible death metal titan. The international group spanning Australia, Denmark, and Finland enters the mix with a 13-minute, 3 track demo showcasing their prowess for old-school death metal. These guys stepped onto the scene with a splash, and I don't expect them to be leaving anytime soon

options.name: Unholy Redeemer - A Fever to Dethrone All Kings - MC

name: Organ Dealer - The Weight of Being - LP
description: The latest full-length by the New Jersey grinders Organ Dealer on 12" vinyl. Frantic and poignant, this release takes a look at the state of our society and tears it to pieces in violent angry bursts. In true grindcore fashion, they managed to squeeze 21 tracks into 23 minutes, each one packed to the gills with catchy riffs, airtight drums, and throat shredding vocals.

options.name: Organ Dealer - The Weight of Being - LP

name: Void Witch - Horripilating Presence - CD, MC
description: The much-anticipated debut full-length by the Texan death/doomsters Void Witch. The absolutely massive and bleak sound these guys present is as catchy as it is punishing. Masterfully flowing from crushing and melodic doom riffs into faster, blasting, ripping death metal segments and back again keeping you constantly on your toes. The songwriting is superb, matched perfectly by the musicianship on display. Void Witch is definitely going to be one to watch out for.

name: Pencil Lead Syringe - Suffocated and Embalmed - CD
description: The debut full-length album by the Californian chaotic brutal death metal group Pencil Lead Syringe. Raw, dirty, and constantly switching between cacophonous wall-of-sound blasts, catchy, melodic riffing, tremolo leads, and pure grinding - this album manages to keep you on your toes for the full run time (~30 minutes, 42 with the hidden bonus track).

options.name: Pencil Lead Syringe - Suffocated and Embalmed - CD

name: Vrykolakas - Nocturnal Dominion of Death - MC
description: The 5th full-length album by the Singapore old-school death metal band Vrykolakas. 40 minutes of death metal sickness, strongly influenced by the likes of Incantation, Immolation, and Sadistic Intent.

options.name: Vrykolakas - Nocturnal Dominion of Death - MC

name: Anastomose - Carnal Decay Odes of Mortality - MC
description: Debut album by the one-man Brazilian grinding death metal project Anastomose. Gore-soaked and full of groove, Anastomose brings the splatter and the riffs via 14 tracks of pure madness. Separated by sick horror samples, this fits right in with Exhumed or Mortician.

options.name: Anastomose - Carnal Decay Odes of Mortality - MC

name: Deepslate - By Any Means - MC
description: 2023 demo by the Florida based death metal/grindcore lunatics Deepslate. Short, sweet, and to the point - these guys waste no time in letting you know what they're all about. Grimy, groovy, and heavy as fuck, this demo will have you banging your head and hoping these guys drop some more music soon.

name: Decedent - Persistent Ruin - MC
description: The 2nd EP by the Michigan death metallers Decedent. Groovy bass lines, pulverizing drums, dissonant, angular guitars riffs, and dual-attack style vocals. Whiplashing between mid-paced death riffs and lightning-fast tremolo/blast beat sections, this EP has everything you need.

name: Father Befouled - Immaculate Pain - CD, MC
description: The latest EP by the Georgian (US) heavy hitters Father Befouled. Featuring 3 new heavy as all hell tracks and a Morbid Angel cover (as well as a bonus Abhorrence cover on the CD version). This EP marks an excellent addition to an already impressive resume, full of pummeling, atmospheric, blasphemous death metal.

name: Pneuma Hagion - From Beyond - CD, MC
description: The latest (3rd) and much anticipated full-length by the Texan black/death project Pneuma Hagion. The duo presents a massive, pummeling force that takes the best from both genres and blend it into this unfiltered, aggressive behemoth that will have you banging your head from start to finish. Crushing yet catchy, you'll be reaching for the play button as soon as this one reaches the end.

name: Olkoth - At the Eye of Chaos - LP
description: The debut full-length by the South Carolinian blackened death group Olkoth. Quite impressive for a first album, Olkoth present a massive soundscape featuring plenty of speed and technicality. Unrelenting but very multi-dimensional, the frenzied playing is an assault on the eardrums, but the excellent production allows every note to cut through the mix. Huge and blasphemous along the lines of Hate Eternal or Morbid Angel - definitely looking forward to more from these guys.

options.name: Olkoth - At the Eye of Chaos - LP

name: Bell Witch - Future's Shadow Part 1: The Clandestine Gate - 2CD
description: The latest epic of funeral doom from the masters Bell Witch on CD. There are a few songs that seem to get mentioned whenever longform doom is brought up - Dopesmoker, The Great Barrier Reefer, and of course Mirror Reaper - I fully expect Future's Shadow to be a staple of that conversation moving forward. This release sees an incredible journey over almost an hour and a half, split over 2 CDs.

options.name: Bell Witch - Future's Shadow Part 1: The Clandestine Gate - 2CD

name: Convocation - No Dawn for the Caliginous Night - LP, CD
description: Blending death metal with funeral doom, Convocation return for their 3rd full-length, featuring 48 minutes of pummeling yet atmospheric glory. This grandiose album is an emotional journey from the start, constantly building to new heights accompanied by organs, synths, and the occasional cello. Crushing and oppressive as funeral doom tends to be, this album manages to feel much livelier than its contemporaries due to the pushing death metal drumming and riffs.

name: Fractal Generator - Convergence - MC
description: The third full-length and latest release by the Ontario based blackened, grinding, experimental death metal trio Fractal Generator, available on cassette tape. If crazy blasts, dissonant angular riffs, mind-blowing polyrhythms, and trips through the 4th, 5th, and 6th dimensions are what you're looking for, then look no further. To say these guys are a bit strange may be an understatement, but the lyrics by vocalist 040118180514 (yes, that's his pseudonym for this particular project) might just transport you to another universe.

name: Seraphic Entombment - Sickness Particles Gleam - 2LP, CD
description: Debut full-length by the Alabama death/doom metallers Seraphic Entombment. Ear-worm riffs, thick bass lines, frenzied drumming, and absolutely tortured vocals, this band checks every death/doom box. Add into that tempo changes and an oppressive, haunting atmosphere, and we've got an instant classic on our hands.

name: Remorseless Records Logo Button
description: 1.5" pinback button with Remorseless Records logo. Can be added to any order or will be tossed in for free on bigger orders

name: Void Rot - Telluric Dismemberment - 7" EP
description: The 2nd EP by Minnesota's Void Rot, following up their debut full-length and likely filling the gap before the next one. Building on their sound from prior releases, the vocals are now drenched in reverb and feel as if they're clawing their way up into the mix. Cavernous yet claustrophobic, these guys certainly managed to capture that feeling of being afloat in the void for all eternity.

name: Black Hole Deity - Profane Geometry - CD
description: Debut full-length by the Alabama death metallers Black Hole Deity. Fast and blasty, technical and nasty, this album is an all-out assault of instrumental proficiency and masterful song crafting. Described as "for fans of Morbid Angel, Nile, and Hate Eternal", this band fits right into the conversation with any one of them. Angular riffs, soaring leads, blasphemous vocals, pulverizing drumbeats, driving bass lines, and a crushing atmosphere - this album covers all the bases of a modern OSDM release.

options.name: Black Hole Deity - Profane Geometry - CD

name: Drowned - Procul His - LP, CD
description: The second full-length album by the German death metallers Drowned. Their first release in 10 years (with just over 20 years of demo releases prior to that), these guys haven't missed a beat and may have managed to get heavier with time. Tight and technical, this is old-school death metal done right. 43 minutes of air-tight drums, winding riffs, thundering bass, old-school growled vocals, and an over-arching air of blasphemy - just what the doctor ordered.

name: Degial - Predator Reign - LP
description: The Uppsala Sweden death metal maniacs Degial return with their 3rd full-length album, their most ruthless and violent to date. Impeccable musicianship and blackened death metal riffage combine, creating a blast of unrelenting rage, only parting to make way for big Morbid Angel style guitar leads. The occasional breaks in the tempo add to the threatening atmosphere, with each track incorporating varied compositions and memorable riffs.

name: Dead Will Walk - As the Bowel Withers - CD
description: The latest CD by Dutch death metallers Dead Will Walk, a compilation album built around their latest EP release which contains all of their released material to date. This includes all 6 tracks from the "A New Day of Dawning" EP, the "Unleash the Dead" EP, tracks from their split with Entrapment, and 2 previously uncollected songs from a Wolfsbane Records compilation and an early promo recording. The old-school death metal sound featured here is reminiscent of Autopsy or maybe early Death, but with a slight Swedish sound to it from the guitar tone and riffage. Very solid and memorable mid-paced death metal, and I'm definitely looking forward to a full-length from these guys.

options.name: Dead Will Walk - As the Bowel Withers - CD

name: Garden of Eyes - Eldritch Death Metal - CD
description: I've said it before and I'll say it again - when a bands name references Bloodborne, you know you're in for some sick, cosmic, Lovecraftian weirdness. Garden of Eyes delivers exactly that with HM-2 riffs, crawling drumbeats, and growled horrors from beyond comprehension. This album compiles tracks from 4 demo releases, plus an exclusive previously unreleased single, for 13 tracks over almost 53 minutes. High insight not required (or recommended), just try not to get your brain sucked.

options.name: Garden of Eyes - Eldritch Death Metal - CD

name: Crypticus / Cropsy Maniac - Cryptmania Split - CD
description: Split album by the death metal project Crypticus, and the grindier death metal band Cropsy Maniac, covering roughly 31 minutes over 11 tracks. Winding, technical riffs set the stage on the Crytpicus opening half, full of blasting, guttural vocals, and old-school horror movie samples. Cropsy Maniac takes over for the back half, with their brand of frantic, lightning fast deathgrind. The 2 sides complement each other incredibly well, and I wouldn't expect anything less from these horror-inspired death metal powerhouses.

options.name: Crypticus / Cropsy Maniac - Cryptmania Split - CD

name: Consecration - Ephemerality - CD
description: The debut full-length by UK death/doom legends Consecration, re-issued and available again after almost 10 years. These guys have absolutely nailed the sound, from the crunchy, sustained guitar tone to the punchy snare and the menacing deep growls, it's the "Peaceville Three" without any of the gothic drama. Effortlessly flowing from catchy doom riffs into the more punishing up-tempo death metal grooves, it's a perfect showcase of what the genre has to offer. Over an hour and 12 minutes of excellence, there's a reason this album has and will continue to stand the test of time.

name: Angelivore - Fleshfeast - CD
description: Debut full-length by the UK death metal project Angelivore. Blasphemous and blasting, this is 40 minutes of pure death metal savagery. Laden with squealing dive-bombs and tremolo picking, the engulfing atmosphere threatens to suffocate while the profanation and pure vitriol keeps the blood pumping.

name: Savage Ruins - World in Wrath - CD
description: Debut full-length by the Indiana death/thrash project Savage Ruins. High energy from start to finish, Phil Segitho brings ideas from each band on his extensive resume, melding them into an impressive 7 tracks over 32 minutes. Ripping leads, pulverizing drumbeats, and an anthemic vocal delivery define the sound, making each track catchier than the last.

options.name: Savage Ruins - World in Wrath - CD

name: Enucleate - Chaorealm - CD
description: Debut EP by the Scottish lads Enucleate. Huge atmospheres, catchy riffs, crushing brutality, and blasphemous lyrics - these tracks are reminiscent of legends such as Morbid Angel and Hate Eternal. Successfully capturing that old-school feel that made many fall in love with this genre, while having enough fresh ideas to set themselves apart.

name: Worm Altar - Compilation Demos - CD
description: Branded as "slow death from Maine", Worm Altar takes the wretched, face-melting sickness of death metal, and adds the plodding, tectonic plate shifting power of doom. Huge riffs and reverb-soaked vocals fill the space in between the thunderous drum beats and horrific atmosphere. This is the kind of metal that will melt your brain into a formless, squirming mass of sludge.

name: Envoys - Glimpse Beyond the Veil - MC
description: Envoys sophomore demo/EP release, Glimpse Beyond the Veil, on professionally produced gold shell cassette tapes. This release marks a major step forward for the young trio, as they improve in all aspects of songwriting, instrumentation, and production. The three-track release is again self-recorded and mixed, clocking in at just over 16 minutes of fuzzy distorted riffs, driving drumbeats, and low heavy growling. Contains a 4-panel insert with lyrics.

options.name: Envoys - Glimpse Beyond the Veil - MC

name: Devoured Death #5
description: Devoured Death zine issue #5, all the way from Victoria Australia. 80 pages in A5 format, stuffed to the gills with interviews and reviews, covering the best in underground death metal from around the world. Featuring: Aglo, Belial, Vacuous, Chaotian, Claustrum, Destruktor, Abyssal Tomb, Impest, Misery, Infamous, Purulency, Neuropath, Discarnation, and Formless Oedon.

name: Eternal Rot - Moribound - CD
description: The death/doom heavyweights Eternal Rot return with their third full-length offering, with the cleverly titled Moribound. These guys never disappoint with their groovy, doom-laden riffs, and this album is no exception. Add to that the oddly compelling gory, zombie style vocals, and this is the perfect soundtrack to fending off a horde of the undead.

name: Martyrdoom - As Torment Prevails - CD
description: The Polish death/doom quartet return with their second full-length, As Torment Prevails. Presumably named for the opening track on Dead Congregation's debut, these guys have managed to forge their own sound firmly rooted in old school death metal with a healthy dose of doom mixed in for good measure. Heavy, dark, and melodic riffs set the stage for some incredible vocals over 8 original tracks, closing out with a terrific cover of Autopsy's In the Grip of Winter

name: Depraver / Vrenth - Split - CD
description: Split CD featuring 2 tracks by the black/thrash outfit Depraver, and 3 tracks by death metal group Vrenth, both out of good 'ol California USA. The Depraver tracks feature an old-school black/thrash assault complete with catchy, headbanging riffs, growled vocals, and big guitar solos. The Vrenth side sees a more straight-forward death metal approach, full of blasts, tremolo picked riffs, and deep guttural vocals. The split maintains a pretty cohesive atmosphere considering the differing styles, and is a great introduction to both bands.

name: Cropsy Maniac - Cult of Cropsy - CD
description: The latest full-length by the death/grind sickos Cropsy Maniac. 12 tracks in 34 minutes of horror themed gore and groove. The frantic assault of blast beats and grind riffs is complemented well by the horror movie samples, throat-tearing vocals, and the occasional big guitar solo. Another incredible output by the masters of the macabre.

options.name: Cropsy Maniac - Cult of Cropsy - CD

name: Echoes of Death - Issue #4
description: Echoes of Death fanzine, issue #4, all the way from western Germany. 48 beautifully laid-out pages in A4 size, featuring interviews with Mortuous, Rude, Profanation, Cancer, Impugner, Tenebro, and Thrash Records, as well as reviews and announcements for upcoming releases.

name: Deathfiend - Beyond Life - CD
description: Birmingham UK based Deathfiend enter the fray with their debut full-length Beyond Life, a pulverizing sludgy punky assault of violence and doom. Anthemic passages bookmarked by doomy riffs and fuzzed out, contemplative guitar leads. Driving drum lines underpin it all, outlining the barely contained vitriol.

name: Force of Darkness - Heritage of Dark Incantations - CD
description: The Chilean deathrash dealers Force of Darkness compilation album, featuring songs from all previous EPs and splits with Bestial Mockery and Wrathprayer, as well as additional unreleased tracks and live recordings. Scorching fast riffs and solos, thrashy vocals, blasty drums, and an overall air of evilness as is customary in this style of blackened death and thrash. This collection covers 3 decades of blasphemy, rounding up these not-to-be-missed gems in a beautifully laid out digipak

options.name: Force of Darkness - Heritage of Dark Incantations - CD

name: Nightfell - Never Comes the Storm - CD
description: The fourth full-length by the Portland, Oregon based Nightfell, Never Comes the Storm. An incredibly moving 30 minutes of the most epic blackened death/doom. By the time the ambiance has swelled and the first driving drum line has come in, you'll be firmly hooked. Huge, encompassing riffs interspersed with melodic acoustic breaks, reverb-drenched choirs, and absolutely crushing vocals, each moment builds towards the next and never leaves you wanting.

options.name: Nightfell - Never Comes the Storm - CD

name: Noxis - Paths of Visceral Fears - CD
description: Compilation album featuring all prior material from the Communion of Corrupted Minds split, Expanse of Hellish Black Mire EP, and the Necrotizing demo. Absolutely ripping death metal from the hellish expanse of Cleveland. These guys have a noticeable focus on rhythm, with each song having its own unique groove pushing forward. The occasional odd Demilich inspired riff keeps you guessing where they're going to go next, while the vocals and bass lines keep things rooted in OSDM territory.

options.name: Noxis - Paths of Visceral Fears - CD

name: Leather Glove - Perpetual Animation / Skin on Glass - CD
description: The California solo project Leather Glove's debut full-length Perpetual Animation, along with the 3 tracks from the demo release Skin on Glass. Adding up to 42 minutes, this is a beautiful combination of death metal savagery and oozing sludgy doom. Greg Wilkinson sports an incredible résumé, including stints in bands such as Autopsy, Static Abyss, Deathgrave, Graves at Sea, and even playing live with Undergang. This solo project takes some of the best of what each of those bands has to offer and fleshes it out into something utterly unique.

options.name: Leather Glove - Perpetual Animation / Skin on Glass - CD

name: Obscurial - Heretic - CD
description: The second full-length by Obscurial from Malaysia, Heretic on CD. Chunky, chuggy, death metal riffs soon make way for soaring leads and thrashy beats, layered with a huge ambient atmosphere and crushing vocals. These guys pull no punches as they dive into the blast beats and tremolo riffs, taking you on a 41 minute journey to hell and back

name: Coffin Curse - The Continuous Nothing - CD
description: The Chilean death metal duo return with their second full-length, The Continuous Nothing. True OSDM with a modern craftsmanship and a certain blasphemous air, this is a 43 minute journey of headbanging goodness. Blasting, ripping, and occasionally meandering, Coffin Curse build on those old-school riffs, fleshing them out into something truly vicious and awe-inspiring.

options.name: Coffin Curse - The Continuous Nothing - CD

name: Mephitic Grave - Dreadful Seizures - CD
description: Coming in strong from Hungary, Mephitic Grave's sophomore offering on CD does not disappoint. Groovy riffs, atomic clock drumming, fetid growling, and an overall crushing atmosphere of creeping dread, this is an album that will absolutely make you bang your head.

name: Formless Oedon - Streams of Rot - CD
description: The debut (and only) full-length by the quartet from the Philippines, Formless Oedon. You know when a band so blatantly references Bloodborne that you're going to be taken on a cosmic journey of esotericism and Lovecraftian weirdness - and this album offers exactly that. Bouncy, circuitous riffs accompanied by blasting drums and croaked vocals take you down a maddening spiral into the darkest recesses of the universe.

options.name: Formless Oedon - Streams of Rot - CD

name: Excarnated Entity - Stillborn in Ash - CD
description: The debut demo by Seattle based Excarnated Entity, remixed and remastered on CD. Opening up with a searing guitar lead before diving straight into the blasts, these guys are absolutely not fucking around. 27 minutes over 4 tracks, expertly transitioning between slow doomy grooves and tremolo picked death metal goodness.

options.name: Excarnated Entity - Stillborn in Ash - CD

name: Nocturnus A.D. - Unicursal - MC
description: The newest full-length by death metal legends Nocturnus on cassette tape. Many bands play under the banner of "old school death metal", but few remain truer to that sound than these guys. The thrashy riffs and vocals will teleport you back to the early 90s, as the signature keyboard and sci-fi soundscapes will take you on a journey through outer space.

name: Phrenelith - Chimaera - MC
description: The sophomore album by the Danish death-metal demons Phrenelith on cassette tape. Leading off with a somber and doomy intro, this album quickly explodes into a maelstrom of incredible drumming by the legendary Polish pummeler Tuna. Huge, meandering guitar leads, deep, doomy bass lines, and monstrous, cavernous vocals tie this album together beautifully.

name: Dead Congregation - Promulgation of the Fall - MC
description: The sophomore full-length by the Greek gods, Promulgation of the Fall on cassette tape. 40 minutes of uncompromising, crushingly heavy, apocalyptic death metal. With clear influence from bands such as Incantation and Immolation, Dead Congregation still manage to define their own sound while maintaining that huge atmosphere and pummeling brutality of their forefathers. The drummer managed to get faster for this release, and those blasting beats matched with twisting, unpredictable leads is a beautiful combination.

options.name: Dead Congregation - Promulgation of the Fall - MC

name: Mizmor - Prosaic - CD
description: The latest full-length from the Oregon based one man black/doom project Mizmor on CD. Going in a slightly different direction from previous releases, Prosaic explores personal themes, feeling much closer to home than both Cairn and Yodh.

name: Deiquisitor - Apotheosis - CD
description: The latest full-length by the Danish trio. The discordant guitars over blasting drums are a potent combo - add to that some well-placed beastly vocals and short guitar leads, and we've got ourselves a modern classic. This one has the oppressive nature of Immolation mixed with the experimental sounds of Gorguts

name: Envoys - To Whom It May Concern - MC
description: Envoys debut demo/EP on professionally produced purple shell cassette tapes. Self-recorded and self-mixed, this six-track demo clocks in at 30 minutes, showcasing the early days of Envoys as they delve into writing and producing doom metal together for the first time.

options.name: Envoys - To Whom It May Concern - MC

name: Sequestrum - Pickled Preservation - MC
description: There must be something in the water over there in Copenhagen - how is it that there are so many absolutely incredible death metal bands in a single city? Of course if that pickling agent is turning out music like this, you won't hear me complaining! A short EP of 7 songs (including an Ipetigo cover) over about 16 minutes, ranging from murky, gory lows, to old-school doom metal leads, this one will certainly leave you wanting more.

name: Grey Skies Fallen - Molded by Broken Hands - CD
description: The 7th full length album by NYC veterans Grey Skies Fallen. It's truly baffling to me that these guys don't get more recognition with such an amazing catalogue going all the way back to the 90's. The slow passages harken back to the glory days of gothic doom, with plenty of upbeat aggressive sections in between to keep you on your toes. Masterful song writing and skillful musicianship is on full display here, with a melodic, progressive journey spanning nearly an hour in length.

options.name: Grey Skies Fallen - Molded by Broken Hands - CD

name: Innumerable Forms - Philosophical Collapse - CD
description: The death/doom powerhouse that is Innumerable Forms returns with their second full-length offering. Another step forward from their previous release, these guys continue to punish earholes everywhere with their absolutely massive sound, exploring numerous emotions through expressive riffs over a nearly 40 minute run time.

name: Mystery Bundle
description:
We have such sounds to show you...

Feeling adventurous? Love finding new music you might have otherwise overlooked? Then you're in the right place.

Each mystery bundle comes with 3 cassettes or CDs chosen at random from inventory. Help make room for new stuff and get a bargain on some killer albums in the process!


Note: Efforts are made to ensure you don't receive duplicates, however this cannot be guaranteed in the case of multiple mystery bundle purchases.
